contentrichtext.text: '''Kaseda''' (加世田市; -shi) was a [[cities of Japan|city]] located in [[Kagoshima Prefecture|Kagoshima]], [[Japan]]. On November 7, 2005 Kaseda was merged with the town of [[Kinpō, Kagoshima|Kinpō]], from [[Hioki District, Kagoshima|Hioki District]], and the towns of [[Bonotsu, Kagoshima|Bonotsu]], [[Kasasa, Kagoshima|Kasasa]] and [[Ōura, Kagoshima|Ōura]] from [[Kawanabe District, Kagoshima|Kawanabe District]], to form the new city of [[Minamisatsuma, Kagoshima|Minamisatsuma]]. As of this merger Kaseda no longer exists. As of 2003, the city had an estimated [[population]] of 23,740 and the [[population density|density]] of 251.56 persons per km². The total area was 94.37 km². The city was founded on July 15, 1954. ==See also== * [[Junya Koizumi]] * [[Yuya Osako]] ==External links== * [http://www.city.minamisatsuma.lg.jp/ Official website of Minamisatsuma] in Japanese {{Kagoshima}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Kagoshima Prefecture]] {{Kagoshima-geo-stub}}
